## Discussion

The [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAlert] class places the accessory view between the informative text or suppression checkbox (if present) and the response buttons. Before you change the location of the accessory view, first call the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAlert/layout()] method.

[doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAlert/alertStyle] shows an example of adding an accessory view to an alert. [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAlert/buttons] shows the alert generated.

Listing 1. Adding an accessory view to an alert

items.description: Specifies that the alert must do immediate layout instead of lazily just before display.
items.name: layout()

items.description: Specifies whether the alert has a help button.
items.name: showsHelp
